# ğŸ—ºï¸ Bandmate Roadmap

This roadmap describes the planned evolution of **Bandmate**.
It is a living document and may change as the product grows, feedback is received, and priorities evolve.

The roadmap is organized in **phases**, each one building on top of the previous, always prioritizing usability, musical flow, and long-term scalability.

---

## ğŸ¯ Guiding Principles

- Build for real musicians and real workflows
- Reduce friction at every step
- Ship small, usable improvements
- Prefer clarity over feature overload
- Lay strong foundations before scaling

---

## ğŸš€ Phase 1 â€” MVP Foundation (Current)

**Goal:** Deliver a solid, usable core experience for individual musicians.

### Core Features

- Songs CRUD
- Lyrics + chords editor
- Clean song visualization
- Automatic persistence (no manual save)
- Basic setlists
- Practice-focused navigation

### UX & UI

- Readable typography for lyrics and chords
- Stable layouts with minimal distractions
- Responsive design for desktop and tablet

### Technical

- Angular standalone architecture
- Signals-based state management
- Feature-based folder structure
- Local persistence strategy
- Shared UI components foundation

**Status:** ğŸŸ¡ In progress

---

## ğŸ¼ Phase 2 â€” Practice & Flow Enhancements

**Goal:** Make Bandmate a daily practice companion.

### Features

- Auto-scroll for lyrics and chords
  - Configurable speed
  - Pause / resume
- Keyboard shortcuts for practice mode
- Improved song view for hands-free use

### UX

- Focus mode (reduced UI)
- Visual rhythm alignment improvements
- Subtle animations only where useful

**Status:** ğŸ”µ Planned

## ğŸ“ Final Notes
